alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued April 02 at 2:06PM PDT until April 04 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT FOR LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Sneaker waves possible. High surf conditions possible for Monday through Tuesday morning. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...From late tonight through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Sneaker waves can surge high up the beach without warning, catching an inattentive individual off guard. They can run up significantly farther on a beach than normal, including over rocks and jetties as well as lifting or rolling extremely heavy logs. If you see someone or a pet swept into the sea, do not swim in after them. Call 911, and keep an eye on them until help arrives. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Those in and near the surf zone, especially those digging for razor clams, should remain vigilant and aware of the ocean and surf. Remember, never turn your back to the sea.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
